title: Bangladesh Court Opens Murder Case Against Ex-PM Sheikh Hasina
content: A court in Bangladesh opened a murder investigation into ousted ex-premier Sheikh Hasina and six top figures in her administration Tuesday over the police killing of a man during civil unrest last month.
summary: A court in Bangladesh opened a murder investigation into ousted ex-premier Sheikh Hasina and six top figures in her administration Tuesday over the police killing of a man during civil unrest last month.

title: S Jaishankar's 5-Year World Prediction Amid West Asia War Fears, US Election
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has painted a bleak picture of where the world might be in five years, warning of a "very grim forecast" given military tension in West Asia, between Ukraine and Russia, and in Southeast Asia.
summary: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar has painted a bleak picture of where the world might be in five years, warning of a "very grim forecast" given military tension in West Asia, between Ukraine and Russia, and in Southeast Asia.

title: Bangladesh Court Opens Murder Case Against Sheikh Hasina
content: A court in Bangladesh opened a murder investigation into ousted ex-premier Sheikh Hasina and six top figures in the previous government over the police killing of a man during civil unrest last month.
summary: A court in Bangladesh opened a murder investigation into ousted ex-premier Sheikh Hasina and six top figures in the previous government over the police killing of a man during civil unrest last month.

title: Iran Attack On Israel Imminent? US Intelligence Issues Big Warning
content: Iran or its proxies are "increasingly likely" to launch an attack on Israel in the upcoming days, the White House warned, citing intelligence.
summary: Iran or its proxies are "increasingly likely" to launch an attack on Israel in the upcoming days, the White House warned, citing intelligence.

title: Turkish Woman Arrested For Criticising Instagram Ban, Insulting Erdogan
content: A Turkish court on Monday ordered the arrest of a woman on charges of inciting hatred and insulting the president after she criticised a ban on social media platform Instagram, broadcaster Haberturk and other media said.
summary: A Turkish court on Monday ordered the arrest of a woman on charges of inciting hatred and insulting the president after she criticised a ban on social media platform Instagram, broadcaster Haberturk and other media said.

title: Man Freed During Gaza Ceasefire Killed By Israeli Forces In West Bank
content: A Palestinian prisoners watchdog said Tuesday that a man shot dead by Israeli forces in the occupied West Bank the previous day had been freed during the November truce in the Gaza war.
summary: A Palestinian prisoners watchdog said Tuesday that a man shot dead by Israeli forces in the occupied West Bank the previous day had been freed during the November truce in the Gaza war.

title: New Algorithm Analyses Tongue To Predict Diabetes, Stroke With 98% Accuracy
content: Researchers have developed a novel computer algorithm that can predict various diseases like diabetes or stroke, just by analysing the colour of the human tongue with 98 per cent accuracy.
summary: Researchers have developed a novel computer algorithm that can predict various diseases like diabetes or stroke, just by analysing the colour of the human tongue with 98 per cent accuracy.

title: Water 20 km Below Mars Surface? What Study Shows And What It Means
content: Water is considered essential for life, and geological studies show the planet's surface had lakes, rivers and oceans more than 3 billion years ago.
summary: Water is considered essential for life, and geological studies show the planet's surface had lakes, rivers and oceans more than 3 billion years ago.

title: US Student Gets 21 Months In Prison For Threatening Jewish Classmates
content: A former Cornell University student was sentenced to 21 months in prison on Monday for threatening Jewish classmates. Patrick Dai posted the threats anonymously on an online campus bulletin board three weeks after the October 7 Hamas attack on Israel
summary: A former Cornell University student was sentenced to 21 months in prison on Monday for threatening Jewish classmates. Patrick Dai posted the threats anonymously on an online campus bulletin board three weeks after the October 7 Hamas attack on Israel

title: Japan Airport Runway Shut After US Cargo Plane Makes Emergency Landing
content: One of the two runways at Japan's Narita Airport was closed on Tuesday after an American cargo plane made an emergency landing due to an issue with its hydraulic system, officials said.
summary: One of the two runways at Japan's Narita Airport was closed on Tuesday after an American cargo plane made an emergency landing due to an issue with its hydraulic system, officials said.

title: Hamas Says It Killed A Hostage, Injured 2 Others In Gaza, Israel Responds
content: The armed wing of Palestinian group Hamas said Monday its operatives had shot and killed an Israeli hostage and wounded two others, both women, "in two separate incidents" in Gaza.
summary: The armed wing of Palestinian group Hamas said Monday its operatives had shot and killed an Israeli hostage and wounded two others, both women, "in two separate incidents" in Gaza.

title: Body Found Inside Burned-Out Athens Factory As Wildfire Continues To Spread
content: A woman's body was found early Tuesday inside a burned-out Athens factory, state news agency ANA said, in what is believed to be the first reported death from a disastrous wildfire that has scorched the city's northeastern suburbs.
summary: A woman's body was found early Tuesday inside a burned-out Athens factory, state news agency ANA said, in what is believed to be the first reported death from a disastrous wildfire that has scorched the city's northeastern suburbs.

title: Vladimir Putin To Discuss Middle East Situation With Palestinian President
content: Russia's President Vladimir Putin will discuss the situation in the Middle East with Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas in Moscow on Tuesday, the Kremlin said late on Monday.
summary: Russia's President Vladimir Putin will discuss the situation in the Middle East with Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas in Moscow on Tuesday, the Kremlin said late on Monday.

title: Benjamin Netanyahu, His Defence Minister Clash Over Gaza Hostage Deal
content: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Defence Minister Yoav Gallant exchanged criticism on Monday over stalled talks for a ceasefire deal that would free hostages held in Gaza.
summary: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and Defence Minister Yoav Gallant exchanged criticism on Monday over stalled talks for a ceasefire deal that would free hostages held in Gaza.

title: Earth Witnesses Hottest July Ever, 14th Straight Record-Breaking Month
content: Last month was the hottest July on record, making it the fourteenth straight record-breaking month, a US environmental agency reported Monday.
summary: Last month was the hottest July on record, making it the fourteenth straight record-breaking month, a US environmental agency reported Monday.

title: New York's Notorious 'Night-Life' Lawyer Found Dead Outside Parents' Home
content: Salvatore Strazzullo, the New York City lawyer notorious for his colourful client roster and personal scandals, was found dead in his car outside his parents' Brooklyn home on Saturday.
summary: Salvatore Strazzullo, the New York City lawyer notorious for his colourful client roster and personal scandals, was found dead in his car outside his parents' Brooklyn home on Saturday.

title: Trump Vowed To Never To Do This Again, But Did It During Musk Interview
content: Donald Trump today spent nearly an hour discussing the recent assassination attempt, something he had promised never to talk about again.
summary: Donald Trump today spent nearly an hour discussing the recent assassination attempt, something he had promised never to talk about again.

title: Earth Hit By "Intense" Solar Storm, Likely To Trigger More Northern Lights
content: The new solar storm is caused by coronal mass ejections (CMEs), which are explosions of particles leaving the Sun. When these particles arrive on Earth, they disrupt its magnetic field.
summary: The new solar storm is caused by coronal mass ejections (CMEs), which are explosions of particles leaving the Sun. When these particles arrive on Earth, they disrupt its magnetic field.

title: After Trump, Elon Musk "Happy To Host" Kamala Harris Ahead Of US Polls
content: Donald Trump said that the country "will go out of business," if Kamala Harris wins US elections 2024.
summary: Donald Trump said that the country "will go out of business," if Kamala Harris wins US elections 2024.

title: "If I Hadn't Turned My Head...": Top Quotes From Trump's Interview With Musk
content: Donald Trump spoke with Elon Musk on the microblogging site, X, where he discussed the 2024 US presidential elections, his Democratic counterpart Kamala Harris, and climate change.
summary: Donald Trump spoke with Elon Musk on the microblogging site, X, where he discussed the 2024 US presidential elections, his Democratic counterpart Kamala Harris, and climate change.
